rComments: Unfair and inaccurate marking by TA Cynthia and Prof Maiolino (especially Prof) so be prepared to do grade appeals to Soc Dept. Disappointment.

Took SOC204 at UTSG and there were too many papers with no clear grading criteria for any of them. TA is very opinioned so if your work doesn't align with her views then you'll lose a lot of marks. Not just this but there are plenty of other grading issues in this course as well. Course materials are interesting but grading needs to improve.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader', 'So many papers']

rComments: Prof is usually accessible outside class but you've to be prepared with specific questions as she won't skim through your work to give you feedback. LOTS OF READINGS and TOO MANY PAPERS, so giving you a heads up! Classes are mandatory but helpful. Grading is a HUGE drawback for this course. TA marks very critically and has strong opinions.

I really enjoyed this class. She used a great variety of methods to teach, from slides to videos to group discussions and exercises. This course was a research course so A LOT of work.  Personally, the TA Cynthia wasn't a great marker & didn't provide enough detail to learn from. I did however find this course very beneficial to take.

TA and Prof are extremely tough graders. Prof is accessible and nice in person, but she is very strict when it comes to marking work. Prof & TA looks for very specific things in the essays so I had to put in way too much work in this course to get a good grade. TA sometimes makes mistakes in grading too. Also, you will fail if you skip classes.

30% of the mark comes from in-class participation, so attendance is mandatory. If you skip class, you won't pass. Despite the readings and lectures beings fairly easy to understand, but I'm giving the Prof and her TA Cynthia 1 star for their unfair and inaccurate marking. Get ready to do grade appeals to the Soc Dept if you take this course.
teacherRatingTags: ['Participation matters', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader']

rComments: I had Professor Maiolino for a summer course in UTSG; she is the most respectful, helpful and down to earth professor I have ever met. Attending her office hours with an essay outline & specific question(s) is very helpful as she gives very thorough feedbacks. If you attend all the lectures & do the readings, you'll be good to go.
